dojg.description: An auxiliary which indicates the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.

examples.japanese: (ks).日本経済は今後も成長を続けるであろう。
examples.english: The Japanese economy will probably still keep  growing (literally: from now on, too).

examples.japanese: (a).このようなブームはもう二度と起こらないであろう。
examples.english: Such a boom will probably not happen again.

examples.japanese: (b).この次に起こる地震は非常に大きいであろうと予想される。
examples.english: It is expected that the next earthquake will  (probably) be very strong.

examples.japanese: (c).その交渉は極めて困難であろう。
examples.english: That negotiation will probably be very  difficult.

examples.japanese: (d).この辺りは昔、湖だったであろうと思われる。
examples.english: I think that this area was probably a lake a  long time ago.

dojg.formation:
## 

- Sinformal
- であろう
- {話す/話した}であろう
- Will probably talk/probably talked
- {高い/高かった}であろう
- Is/was probably expensive
- {静か/静かだった}であろう
- Is/was probably quiet
- {先生/先生だった }であろう
- Is/was probably a teacher
- Exception
- {Adjectiveなstem/Noun}であろう
dojg.part_of_speech: Auxiliary (used in writing and formal speech only)
